marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know
marketNews.content:
Coordinator of the Economic Affairs Ministry, Airlangga Hartarto, told the Financial Times that the government is planning a stimulus of US$2 billion to boost consumer spending during the Christmas and New Year holidays. The stimulus package will provide discounts for transportation, food, retail purchases, and tax exemptions for airline tickets. Prior to this, the Financial Times reported that the government had announced a total stimulus of US$4.5 billion since December 2024.

The Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Association (Gapki), Eddy Martono, said that the association expects Indonesia's palm oil exports to increase from 29.5 million tons in 2024 to 30 million tons in 2025, driven by higher purchases from India. This estimate is higher than Gapki's previous projection in July 2025, which forecast 2025 exports at 28 million tons due to the mandatory B40 biodiesel blend. For 2026, Eddy said Indonesian palm oil exports are likely to remain stagnant year-on-year, while total domestic palm oil production is expected to reach 56 million tons, up from an estimated 55 million tons in 2025.

The Constitutional Court on Monday (29 September) annulled the requirement in the law on People's Housing Savings (Tapera) that obliges workers and employers to deposit a portion of wages into the Tapera program. The Court ruled that Tapera contributions must be optional, not mandatory, and gave the House of Representatives two years to revise the law.

Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa temporarily postponed the implementation of a tax on e-commerce merchants with annual turnover between IDR 500 million and IDR 4.8 billion until the economic situation stabilises. Nailul Huda, Director of the Center of Economic and Law Studies, told Kontan that the additional tax revenue from this policy would range between IDR 500 billion and IDR 1.5 trillion.

marketNews.title: What is PE Ratio?
marketNews.content: "Harga Rp50 bisa jadi 'mahal', sedangkan Rp5.000 bisa jadi 'murah', tergantung PE Ratio-nya." – bay1922

tickerNews.title: BBRI 8M25: Net Bank-Only Profit Down 10% YoY
tickerNews.content:
Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded a net bank-only profit of IDR 4 trillion in August 2025 (-16% YoY, +6% MoM). This result brings the net bank-only profit for the first eight months of 2025 (8M25) to IDR 32.6 trillion (-10% YoY), equal to 57% of the 2025 consolidated consensus estimate (versus 8M24: 60% of 2024 consolidated realization).

Provision expenses remain high. The decline in August net profit was caused by weak non-interest income (-25% YoY), which pressured pre-provision operating profit, and a rise in provision expenses (+34% YoY). Over the 8M25 period, net profit fell due to higher operating expenses (+7% YoY) and higher provision expenses (+7% YoY). In August 2025, BBRI booked provision expenses of IDR 3.5 trillion, the highest monthly provision level since the start of the year when January 2025 is excluded (January recorded a management overlay).

Loan growth slightly increased. As of August 2025, loan growth was +6% YoY, a modest rise from June 2025’s +5% YoY, but still below the 2025 consolidated guidance range of +7-9% YoY. In the 2Q25 earnings call, BBRI management indicated that loan growth for the full year 2025 may only reach the lower bound of the guidance, even before the bank received a liquidity injection of IDR 55 trillion from the government.

Key Takeaway: With a declining interest-rate trend, we assess that pressure on banking margins from funding will ease, not only for BBRI but for the sector overall. However, faster economic growth is needed before investors can see accelerated, high-quality loan growth and a reduction in provision levels. From a valuation perspective, BBRI on Tuesday (30/9) traded at approximately 1.8× 1-Year Forward P/BV, about 1.5 standard deviations below its five-year historical average.

tickerNews.title: ERAA SSSG Declines 1.5% YoY in 8M25
tickerNews.content: Erajaya Swasembada (ERAA) recorded same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +3% YoY in August 2025, resulting in an 8M25 SSSG contraction of -1.5% YoY (versus 1H25: -3.1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ERAL SSSG Grows 14.8% YoY in 8M25
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) posted SSSG of +9.2% YoY in August 2025, leading to an 8M25 SSSG increase of +14.8% YoY (versus 1H25: +15.8% YoY). Consolidated, the Erajaya group added 33 stores in August 2025 – 21 stores by ERAA and 6 stores by ERAL – bringing the total number of Erajaya group stores to 2,189 units as of August 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Targets Credit Growth Above 11% YoY in 2026
tickerNews.content: Katadata reported that Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa claimed Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) management targets credit growth above +11% YoY in 2026 – higher than the 2025 guidance of +8-10% YoY – as liquidity improves in the banking sector. The minister explained that the government will pursue faster credit growth starting in two months and will consider withdrawing a IDR 55 trillion fund placement in BBNI if credit growth is deemed weak.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA to 67.2%
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) purchased approximately 234 million shares of Surya Citra Media (SCMA) at an average price of about IDR 353 per share between 23-29 September 2025. The total transaction value was roughly IDR 82.5 billion. After this transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA rose from 66.89% to 67.2%.

tickerNews.title: BIPI to Execute $300-350 Million Waste-to-Energy Project in 2026
tickerNews.content: Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur (BIPI) CEO Raymond Anthony Gerungan said the company will undertake a waste-to-energy project valued at US$300-350 million in 2026, with a feasibility study expected to be completed in the coming weeks. Previously, at the end of 2024, Gerungan indicated that BIPI was participating in a tender for a waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) in Java.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Share Purchase by Meijani Wibowo
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) commissioner Meijani Wibowo bought approximately 3.4 million HEAL shares at an average price of IDR 1,840 per share on 25 September 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 6.3 billion. After the transaction, Meijani Wibowo’s direct ownership in HEAL increased from roughly 1.95% to 1.97%.

tickerNews.title: KETR Expands Domestic and International Sea Freight Business
tickerNews.content: Ketrosden Triasmitra (KETR) plans to add domestic general cargo sea-freight and international general cargo sea-freight activities. The move aligns with the company’s strategy to utilise its existing assets, namely the under-sea fiber-optic cable laying vessel Bentang Bahari, which will be commercialised to third parties. Implementing this expansion requires a sea-freight business licence, and the plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders on 1 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: TBIG Treasury Share Transfer Plan
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) plans to transfer approximately 350.3 million treasury shares (about 1.5% of total shares) to its controlling shareholder, Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte. Ltd., during the period 6 October – 31 December 2025. The maximum number of treasury shares to be transferred in this transaction equals the total treasury shares currently held by the company.
